step_1.title: STEP 1 : Online Application Form
step_1.description: Please follow the steps to complete online application.
step_1.login: 1. Log into <0>SAYT Application System</0>. (For first-time user, please register an account with your email. Even you were former EPYMT student, you still need a valid account to login.)
step_1.reminder_1: - Former EPYMT students must complete the form at the link under "Former EPYMT Applicant" of the online application.
step_1.reminder_2: - Application fee is HK$50 for each EPYMT course.
step_1.reminder_3: - Applicants who apply for more than one course should submit application separately for each course in the same account.
step_1.checkStatus: 3. Check application status. Applicants can also login the account to check their course result in the future.
step_1.checkEmail: 4. We primarily communicate with you via email, and we kindly encourage you to <0>check your email account regularly</0>. This will ensure that you stay informed and do not miss any important information.
step_1.remark: * It is not necessary to send any supporting documents at this stage.

step_2.title: STEP 2 : Admission Screening Test

formerStudents.title: Former students
formerStudents.description: Applicants who have successfully completed any EPYMT course may be exempt from the Admission Screening Test and will be directly admitted to their chosen course(s).

localAndOverseasStudents.title: Details
localAndOverseasStudents.description: All first-time applicants must attend the admission screening test on <0>{{admissionDate}}</0>. Failing to do so will be considered as withdrawing from the application.

step_2.details: The screening test is a take-home exam that assesses whether an applicant has acquired sufficient background knowledge to take EPYMT courses. The question paper will be sent to applicants at <0>10:00 on 1 May 2026 (Friday)</0> by email. Answers should be scanned, combined into a single PDF file, and submitted to the link provided in the email before <0>17:00 on 4 May 2026 (Monday)</0>. Late submissions may not be considered.
